unstructured.description: cT1-2N0, < 3.5cm invasive breast cancer, estrogen-receptor positive or ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) of breast, grade 1-2, mammographically detected, < 2.5 cm, estrogen-receptor positive
Mammogram within 6 months of planned procedure
Fitness for lumpectomy under general anesthesia
Known axillary lymph node positive breast cancer (negative biopsy not required)

Multicentric cancer in the same breast as diagnosed by clinical examination, mammography, ultrasound, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) or pathologic assessment, not amenable to excision with negative margins with a single lumpectomy
Patients known to have BRCA 1/2 gene

Patients with a history of ipsilateral cancer and/or prior in-field radiation are eligible, as IORT would likely be less toxic than repeat whole or partial breast external beam radiation and can allow patients to avoid mastectomy who wish to do so

detail_description:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE:
I. To characterize outcomes after intraoperative single-fraction radiotherapy after breast conserving surgery, measured in terms of local and regional control.

SECONDARY OBJECTIVES:
I. To characterize patterns of ipsilateral in-breast failures.
II. To measure rates and patterns of ipsilateral regional nodal failure.
III. To measure toxicity rates in terms of dermatitis and fibrosis.

OUTLINE:
Patients' medical records are reviewed.
official_title: Intra-Operative Radiation Therapy (IORT) Using the IntraBeam System - A Registry Protocol

outcome_measures.name: Incidence density of local and regional recurrence rate
outcome_measures.description: The incidence density of local and regional recurrence rate will be estimated along with 95% exact confidence intervals.

outcome_measures.name: Incidence of adverse events
outcome_measures.description: Will be presented as frequency counts and percentages.

outcome_measures.name: Ipsilateral in-breast failures
outcome_measures.description: Will be presented as frequency counts and percentages, and failure rates over time will be assessed using Cochran-Mantel Haenszel (or Mantel Cox) test.

outcome_measures.name: Nodal failures
outcome_measures.description: Will be presented as frequency counts and percentages, and failure rates over time will be assessed using Cochran-Mantel Haenszel (or Mantel Cox) test.

outcome_measures.name: Time to local and regional recurrence
outcome_measures.description: Will be estimated using Kaplan-Meier survival procedure along with 95% confidence interval

brief_summary: This study tracks the results of intraoperative radiation therapy (IORT) using the IntraBeam system in patients with early stage breast cancer. The goal of this study is to be sure that IORT is as good as external beam radiation at preventing tumors from growing back in the breast after surgery.
brief_title: Characterizing Outcomes after Intra-Operative Radiation Therapy Using the IntraBeam System in Patients with Early Stage Breast Cancer
study_population_description: Patients planned for lumpectomy with or without sentinel node biopsy for early stage breast cancer
